headline: U.S. oil stocks explode after Trump’s actions, comments on Venezuela
summary: Investing.com -- Oil stocks rose sharply on Monday after U.S. President Donald Trump said Venezuela’s removal from Nicolas Maduro’s rule could unlock access to the country’s massive oil resources, potentially altering global energy dynamics.

headline: US invades Venezuela, market reaction, CES kicks off: 3 Things
summary: Oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) and related stocks rise following the US invasion of Venezuela and capture of President Nicolás Maduro. US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) inch slightly higher in Monday's premarket in response to the geopolitical headlines. CES 2026 kicks off today in Las Vegas with presentations from Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) CEO Lisa Su. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: US invades Venezuela, market reaction, CES kicks off: 3 Things
content.description:
Oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) and related stocks rise following the US invasion of Venezuela and capture of President Nicolás Maduro.

US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) inch slightly higher in Monday's premarket in response to the geopolitical headlines.

CES 2026 kicks off today in Las Vegas with presentations from Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) CEO Lisa Su.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Stocks Set to Open Higher as Investors Stay Calm Despite Venezuela Tumult, U.S. Jobs Data Awaited
summary: March S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESH26) are up +0.27%, and March Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQH26) are up +0.64% this morning, pointing to a higher open on Wall Street despite fresh geopolitical tensions following the U.S. military operation that captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

content.title: Stocks Set to Open Higher as Investors Stay Calm Despite Venezuela Tumult, U.S. Jobs Data Awaited
content.summary: March S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESH26) are up +0.27%, and March Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQH26) are up +0.64% this morning, pointing to a higher open on Wall Street despite fresh geopolitical tensions following the U.S. military operation that captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

headline: Venezuela oil: Energy giants likely to invest in infrastructure
summary: Oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) are rising Monday morning following President Trump's ousting of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro over the weekend. Energy giants are already looking to invest billions of dollars into reviving Venezuela's oil market and rebuilding its oil infrastructure. Hedgeye Risk Management energy analyst Fernando Valle lists the operators and refiners, like Chevron (CVX) and Exxon Mobil (XOM), who would have so much to gain from this opportunity. China — one of Venezuela's biggest trade allies for oil — has condemned the invasion. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

Hedgeye Risk Management energy analyst Fernando Valle lists the operators and refiners, like Chevron (CVX) and Exxon Mobil (XOM), who would have so much to gain from this opportunity.

China — one of Venezuela's biggest trade allies for oil — has condemned the invasion.
